com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class ItemSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ItemSettings

  • public final class ItemSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of schedule items in the calendar component.

      • getStyle

        public Style getStyle()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the Style used to paint schedule items that don't have a distinct style assigned to them.
        Returns:
        A Style object defining the appearance of schedule items. This property cannot be null.

      • getPointedItemStyle

        public Style getPointedItemStyle()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the Style used to paint items when they are pointed with the mouse.

        This property is ignored when ItemSettings.getUseExtendedStyles() is false.

        Returns:
        A Style object defining the appearance of schedule items when they are pointed with the mouse. This property cannot be null.

      • getSize

        public java.lang.Integer getSize()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the size of schedule items drawn in the calendar.

        This property specifies the height of horizontal items or the width of vertical items. The items length is defined by their start time and duration. The property is ignored for items drawn in timetable view.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying items width or height in pixels.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets the size of schedule items drawn in the calendar.

        This property specifies the height of horizontal items or the width of vertical items. The items length is defined by their start time and duration. The property is ignored for items drawn in timetable view.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying items width or height in pixels. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSpacing

        public java.lang.Integer getSpacing()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the amount of space between adjacent items.
        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying how many pixels there are between adjacent items.

      • setSpacing

        public void setSpacing(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets the amount of space between adjacent items.
        Parameters:

      • getPadding

        public java.lang.Integer getPadding()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the amount of space between each item and the frame lines of the calendar cell that contains the item.

        In a Timetable view this is the distance between consecutive items.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying how many pixels there are left between items and the time cells containing them.

      • setPadding

        public void setPadding(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets the amount of space between each item and the frame lines of the calendar cell that contains the item.

        In a Timetable view this is the distance between consecutive items.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying how many pixels there are left between items and the time cells containing them. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getPaddingLeft

        public java.lang.Integer getPaddingLeft()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the distance between the left side of an item and the left side of the cell containing it.

      • setPaddingLeft

        public void setPaddingLeft(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets the amount of space between the left side of an item and left frame line of the calendar cell that contains the item.
        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the distance between the left side of an item and the left side of the cell containing it. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme. Set to -1 to indicate that this property should be ignored and the value of Padding should be regarded instead.

      • getShowContinuationArrows

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowContinuationArrows()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether to display small arrows at the beginning or at the end of each incomplete segment to indicate that the schedule item continues in an adjacent calendar cell.
        Returns:

      • getShadowOffset

        public java.lang.Integer getShadowOffset()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets the offset of the shadows from the items.
        Returns:
        An integer value specifying with how many pixels an item's shadow is offset from the item. The allowed values range from 1 to 5.

        Parameters:

        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets the size of the item header for non all-day items in the Timetable view.
        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the size of the item header. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme. Set to 0 to hide the item header.

      • getUseStyledText

        public java.lang.Boolean getUseStyledText()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether formatting tags such as <b> and <i> are taken into consideration in the items' description text.

        Styled text allows applying various attributes to the characters it contains. Attributes are specified using HTML-like formatting tags embedded in the raw text.

        Returns:
        true to enable the use of formatting tags in the item's description; otherwise, false.

      • setUseStyledText

        public void setUseStyledText(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether formatting tags such as <b> and <i> are taken into consideration in the items' description text.

        Styled text allows applying various attributes to the characters it contains. Attributes are specified using HTML-like formatting tags embedded in the raw text.

        Parameters:
        value - true to enable the use of formatting tags in the item's description; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getShowClocks

        public ShowClocks getShowClocks()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings

        Returns:
        One of the ShowClocks constants.

      • setShowClocks

        public void setShowClocks(ShowClocks value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets whether and when the clocks displaying the items' start and end time are shown.
        Parameters:
        value - One of the ShowClocks constants or null. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getUseExtendedStyles

        public java.lang.Boolean getUseExtendedStyles()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the appropriate styles are used when an item is pointed with the mouse.

        If this value is false, the pointed styles (that is, ItemSettings.getPointedItemStyle() and ItemSettings.getPointedSelectedItemStyle()) are ignored.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setUseExtendedStyles

        public void setUseExtendedStyles(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the appropriate styles are used when an item is pointed with the mouse.

        If this value is false, the pointed styles (that is, ItemSettings.getPointedItemStyle() and ItemSettings.getPointedSelectedItemStyle()) are ignored.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • setScaleClocks

      • getEnableDefaultRendering

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableDefaultRendering()
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the default item rendering is enabled.

        You can disable this property when you perform complete custom drawing of your items and don't want the Calendar control to perform default painting. This way you can substantially optimize the performance of your application.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value specifying whether the control should paint schedule items.

      • setEnableDefaultRendering

        public void setEnableDefaultRendering(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the default item rendering is enabled.

        You can disable this property when you perform complete custom drawing of your items and don't want the Calendar control to perform default painting. This way you can substantially optimize the performance of your application.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value specifying whether the control should paint schedule items. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • addChangeListener

        public void addChangeListener(ChangeListener listener)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Adds a ChangeListener to the settings.
        Parameters:
        listener - The ChangeListener to be added.

      • removeChangeListener

        public void removeChangeListener(ChangeListener listener)
        Description copied from class: ItemSettings
        Removes the specified ChangeListener from the settings.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be removed.
